description.narrative:
Skatteverket och General Department of Taxation i Kambodja har ansökt om finansiering från Sida för att genomföra "Cooperation Agreement between General Department of Taxation and the Swedish Tax Agency” i Kambodja under perioden 2020-2022.
Insatsen syftar till att modernisera det nationella systemet för inhemsk skattehantering för att svara på förändrade socioekonomiska förhållanden i Kambodja genom expertrådgivning inom följande områden: 1) Risk- och kontanthantering; 2) Tjänster för skattebetalare; 3) Personlig inkomstskatt (PIT) och kapitalvinstskatt (CGT); 4) Strategiska frågor kopplade till små, medelhöga och stora skattebetalare och; 5) Forum för skattesystemreformfrågor.
Skatteverket kommer att genomföra insatsen tillsammans med General Department of Taxation i Kambodja. Department of Economic Policy inom Ministry of Economy and Finance är också en viktig intressent som kommer kunna få mottaga expertrådgivning från skatteverket. Insatsens totala budget är SEK 22 000 000.

The Swedish Tax Agency and the General Department of Taxation in Cambodia have applied to Sida for funding to carry out the "Cooperation Agreement between the General Department of Taxation and the Swedish Tax Agency" in Cambodia during the period 2020-2022.
The intervention aims to modernize the domestic revenue collection system to respond to the changing socio-economic environment by providing expertise in the following areas: 1) Risk Management and Cash Sector; 2) Taxpayer Service, including Taxpayer Education and Website content; 3) Personal Income Tax and Capital Gain; 4) Small, Medium and Large Taxpayer strategic issues and; 5) Forum for Tax System Reform issues.
The Department of Economic Policy within the Ministry of Economy and Finance is also a key stakeholder who will be a recipient of expertise from the Swedish Tax Agency. The intervention’s total budget is SEK 22,000,000.

The intervention forms one part of the Partnership for Accountability and Transparency (PAT) II programme. The PAT programme aims to complement EU's sector budget support to the PFM reform with the objective to facilitate "an enabling environment for the PFM reform by strengthened demand for and supply of public transparency and accountability through institutional capacity development". The overall objective for the intervention in the area of revenue mobilization is "to modernize the domestic revenue collection system to respond to the changing socio-economic environment (RMS II)". GDT and STA will collaborate in four different components and a fifth component will also involve Department of Economic Policy within MEF. The expected outcomes per component are: Component 1: Risk Management and Cash Sector: - GDT works in a structured way with prioritised voluntary compliance and risks supporting fair competition - Increased knowledge experience within GDT about how Compliance Risk Management - on strategic as well as operational level - can enhance taxpayer compliance Component 2: Taxpayer Service - Taxpayers in Cambodia are in general satisfied with the interaction with GDT in order to get service/information - Increased experience and strengthened knowledge within GDT about how taxpayer services contribute to increased voluntary compliance by improved information and transparency Component 3: Personal Income Tax (PIT) and Capital Gains Tax (CGT) - Concerned citizens of Cambodia are filing CGT Component 4: Small, Medium and Large taxpayers – strategic issues - Increased experience and strengthened knowledge about the taxpayers' perception of their buisness processes and how tax administration can support their voluntary compliance for a fair and growing economy is used in GDT's planning Component 5: Forum for Tax System Reform Issues - Increased cooperation between MEF and GDT in Tax System Reform matters

description.narrative: 2020 is the first year of the second agreement phase of the cooperation between Cambodian General Department of Taxation (GDT) and the Swedish Tax Agency (STA). This institutional cooperation between GDT and STA is a part by the overall Partnership for Accountability and Transparency (PAT) programme co-funded by Sida and EU. The most recent report submitted in February 2020 covers implementation of the previous agreement phase and is therefore assessed in the Completion Report of the former contribution. The first report from the new agreement phase will be submitted in February 2021.
